intro: Chaetanthera pubescens, commonly known as the hairy chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
